definition: Nuojuluo, monk at start of Tang dynasty, possibly originally immigrant, lived in Qingshen county 青神[Qing1 shen2], Sichuan
another name for Sakyamuni 釋迦牟尼佛|释迦牟尼佛, the historical Buddha
Buddha Kassapa (Pāli) or Kāśyapa (Skt) (one of the Buddhas of the past)
Prince Ananda, cousin of the Buddha and his closest disciple
Prince Ananda, cousin of the Buddha and his closest disciple
arhat (Sanskrit)/a holy man who has left behind all earthly desires and concerns and attained nirvana (Buddhism)
World Honored One/Revered One of the World (Buddha)
Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya)/Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism
Manes (3rd century AD), Persian prophet and founder of Manichaeism
Sakya (name of a north Indian tribe)/abbr. for 釋迦牟尼|释迦牟尼 Sakyamuni Buddha/sugar apple
to extinguish worries and the sea of grief/nirvana (Buddhism)
